channel.title: +Cooking on Vishvas's notes
channel.description: Recent content in +Cooking on Vishvas's notes

item.title: Instant food
item.description: Oats Just mix with milk or water. Preferably heat for taste. Mix with nuts, berries etc.. rAgi-hurihiTTu Just mix water or milk.. Make into balls, paste or porridge.. No need to cook.

item.title: Techniques
item.description: Freezing Store all foods at 0 F or lower to retain vitamin content, color, flavor and texture. Freezing preserves cooked food for long durations. Defrosting Never defrost foods in a garage, basement, car, dishwasher or plastic garbage bag; out on the kitchen counter, outdoors or on the porch. There are three safe ways to defrost food: in the refrigerator, in cold water, or in the microwave. [Ref] Refreezing: It is safe to refreeze, provided you did not introduce or allow the multiplication of bacteria during thawing.

item.title: Utensils
item.description: Use Iron and stainless steel. Teflon-coated non-stick kadhais may leach into food. Use cast iron pans instead. Exposure to aluminium lowers the levels of zinc, an important mineral for our bodies.
